001package squidpony.squidgrid.gui;
002
003import java.awt.*;
004import java.awt.font.FontRenderContext;
005import java.awt.font.GlyphVector;
006import java.awt.image.BufferedImage;
007import java.util.HashMap;
008import java.util.HashSet;
009import java.util.Set;
010import squidpony.squidgrid.gui.SColor;
011import squidpony.squidgrid.Direction;
012
013/**
014 * Class for creating text blocks.
015 *
016 * This class defaults to using the JVM's default Serif font at size 12, no
017 * padding, and antialias on. If more vertical padding is needed, it is
018 * recommended to try adding it mostly to the top. Often a padding of 1 on top
019 * can give a good appearance.
020 *
021 * After all settings are set, one of the initialization methods must be called
022 * before the factory can be used.
023 *
024 * In order to easily support Unicode, strings are treated as a series of code
025 * points.
026 *
027 * All images have transparent backgrounds.
028 *
029 * @author Eben Howard - http://squidpony.com - howard@squidpony.com
030 */
031public class TextCellFactory {
032
033    /**
034     * The commonly used symbols in roguelike games.
035     */
036    public static final String DEFAULT_FITTING = "@!#$%^&*()_+1234567890-=~ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz;:,'\"{}?/\\";
037
038    private int verticalOffset = 0, horizontalOffset = 0;//how far the baseline needs to be moved based on squeezing the cell size
039    private Font font = Font.decode("Serif");
040    private String fitting = DEFAULT_FITTING;
041    private Set<Integer> largeCharacters;//size on only the largest characters, determined as sizing is performed
042    private boolean antialias = true;
043    private int leftPadding = 0, rightPadding = 0, topPadding = 0, bottomPadding = 0;
044    private int width = 1, height = 1;
045    private ImageCellMap map;
046    private boolean initialized = false;
047
048    /**
049     * Creates a default valued factory. One of the initialization methods must
050     * be called before this factory can be used!
051     */
052    public TextCellFactory() {
053    }
054
055    /**
056     * Initializes the factory to then be able to create text cells on demand.
057     *
058     * Will match the width and height to best match the provided font. This
059     * causes any provided width and height to be ignored.
060     *
061     * Calling this after the factory has already been initialized will
062     * re-initialize it.
063     *
064     * @return this for method chaining
065     */
066    public TextCellFactory initByFont() {
067        initialized = true;
068        map = new ImageCellMap();
069        initializeByFont(font);
070        map = new ImageCellMap(width, height);
071        return this;
072    }
073
074    /**
075     * Initializes the factory to then be able to create text cells on demand.
076     *
077     * Will strictly use the provided width and height values to size the cells.
078     * The provided font will be used as a maximum size for the cells, but will
079     * be shrunk down if the provided font will not fit the requested size.
080     *
081     * Calling this after the factory has already been initialized will
082     * re-initialize it.
083     *
084     * @return this for method chaining
085     */
086    public TextCellFactory initBySize() {
087        initialized = true;
088        map = new ImageCellMap(width, height);
089        initializeBySize(width, height, font);
090        return this;
091    }
092
093    /**
094     * Initializes the factory to then be able to create text cells on demand.
095     *
096     * Will strictly use the provided width and height values to size the cells.
097     * The provided font will be used as the exact size for the cells. Does no
098     * fitting, assumes you know what you're doing.
099     *
100     * Calling this after the factory has already been initialized will
101     * re-initialize it.
102     *
103     * @return this for method chaining
104     */
105    public TextCellFactory initVerbatim() {
106        initialized = true;
107        map = new ImageCellMap(width, height);
108        initializeVerbatim(width, height, font);
109        return this;
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Returns the font used by this factory.
114     *
115     * @return the font
116     */
117    public Font font() {
118        return font;
119    }
120
121    /**
122     * Sets this factory to use the provided font.
123     *
124     * @param font the font to use
125     * @return this factory for method chaining
126     */
127    public TextCellFactory font(Font font) {
128        this.font = font;
129        return this;
130    }
131
132    /**
133     * Returns the width of a single cell.
134     *
135     * @return the width
136     */
137    public int width() {
138        return width;
139    }
140
141    /**
142     * Sets the factory's cell width to the provided value. Clamps at 1 on the
143     * lower bound to ensure valid calculations.
144     *
145     * @param width the desired width
146     * @return this factory for method chaining
147     */
148    public TextCellFactory width(int width) {
149        this.width = Math.max(1, width);
150        return this;
151    }
152
153    /**
154     * Returns the height of a single cell.
155     *
156     * @return
157     */
158    public int height() {
159        return height;
160    }
161
162    /**
163     * Sets the factory's cell height to the provided value. Clamps at 1 on the
164     * lower bound to ensure valid calculations.
165     *
166     * @param height the desired width
167     * @return this factory for method chaining
168     */
169    public TextCellFactory height(int height) {
170        this.height = Math.max(1, height);
171        return this;
172    }
173
174    /**
175     * Returns the current String of code points that are used for sizing the
176     * cells.
177     *
178     * Note that this is actually a set of codepoints and treating them as an
179     * array of chars might give undesired results.
180     *
181     * @return the String used for sizing calculations
182     */
183    public String fit() {
184        return fitting;
185    }
186
187    /**
188     * Sets the characters that will be guaranteed to fit to the provided ones.
189     * This will override any previously set string.
190     *
191     * @param fit the String of code points to size to
192     * @return this factory for method chaining
193     */
194    public TextCellFactory fit(String fit) {
195        fitting = fit;
196        return this;
197    }
198
199    /**
200     * Adds the code points in the string to the list of characters that will be
201     * guaranteed to fit.
202     *
203     * @param fit the String of code points to size to
204     * @return this factory for method chaining
205     */
206    public TextCellFactory addFit(String fit) {
207        fitting += fit;
208        return this;
209    }
210
211    /**
212     * Returns whether this factory is currently set to do antialiasing on the
213     * characters rendered.
214     *
215     * @return true if antialiasing is set
216     */
217    public boolean antialias() {
218        return antialias;
219    }
220
221    /**
222     * When set to true, all fonts will be rendered with antialiasing.
223     *
224     * @param antialias true for antialiasing
225     * @return this factory for method chaining
226     */
227    public TextCellFactory antialias(boolean antialias) {
228        this.antialias = antialias;
229        return this;
230    }
231
232    /**
233     * Sets the amount of padding on all sides to the provided value.
234     *
235     * @param padding how much padding in pixels
236     * @return this for method chaining
237     */
238    public TextCellFactory padding(int padding) {
239        leftPadding = padding;
240        rightPadding = padding;
241        topPadding = padding;
242        bottomPadding = padding;
243        return this;
244    }
245    
246    /**
247     * Returns the padding on the left side.
248     * 
249     * @return amount of padding in pixels
250     */
251    public int leftPadding() {
252        return leftPadding;
253    }
254
255    /**
256     * Sets the amount of padding on the left side to the provided value.
257     *
258     * @param padding how much padding in pixels
259     * @return this for method chaining
260     */
261    public TextCellFactory leftPadding(int padding) {
262        leftPadding = padding;
263        return this;
264    }
265
266    /**
267     * Returns the padding on the right side.
268     * 
269     * @return amount of padding in pixels
270     */
271    public int rightPadding() {
272        return rightPadding;
273    }
274    
275    /**
276     * Sets the amount of padding on the right side to the provided value.
277     *
278     * @param padding how much padding in pixels
279     * @return this for method chaining
280     */
281    public TextCellFactory rightPadding(int padding) {
282        rightPadding = padding;
283        return this;
284    }
285
286    /**
287     * Returns the padding on the top side.
288     * 
289     * @return amount of padding in pixels
290     */
291    public int topPadding() {
292        return topPadding;
293    }
294    
295    /**
296     * Sets the amount of padding on the top side to the provided value.
297     *
298     * @param padding how much padding in pixels
299     * @return this for method chaining
300     */
301    public TextCellFactory topPadding(int padding) {
302        topPadding = padding;
303        return this;
304    }
305
306    /**
307     * Returns the padding on the bottom side.
308     * 
309     * @return amount of padding in pixels
310     */
311    public int bottomPadding() {
312        return bottomPadding;
313    }
314    
315    /**
316     * Returns true if this factory is fully initialized and ready to build text cells.
317     * 
318     * @return true if initialized
319     */
320    public boolean initialized() {
321        return initialized;
322    }
323    
324    /**
325     * Sets the amount of padding on the bottom side to the provided value.
326     *
327     * @param padding how much padding in pixels
328     * @return this for method chaining
329     */
330    public TextCellFactory bottomPadding(int padding) {
331        bottomPadding = padding;
332        return this;
333    }
334
335    private void initializeByFont(Font font) {
336        this.font = font;
337        largeCharacters = new HashSet<>();
338        map.clear();
339        sizeCellByFont();
340        map.clear();
341    }
342
343    private void initializeBySize(int cellWidth, int cellHeight, Font font) {
344        this.width = cellWidth;
345        this.height = cellHeight;
346        this.font = font;
347        largeCharacters = new HashSet<>();
348        map.clear();
349        sizeCellByDimension();
350        map.clear();
351    }
352    private void initializeVerbatim(int cellWidth, int cellHeight, Font font) {
353        this.width = cellWidth;
354        this.height = cellHeight;
355        this.horizontalOffset = cellWidth / 2;
356        this.verticalOffset = 0;
357        this.font = font;
358        largeCharacters = new HashSet<>();
359        map.clear();
360    }
361
362    private void sizeCellByFont() {
363        width = 1;
364        height = 1;
365
366        //temporarily remove padding values
367        int tempLeftPadding = leftPadding;
368        int tempRightPadding = rightPadding;
369        int tempTopPadding = topPadding;
370        int tempBottomPadding = bottomPadding;
371        leftPadding = 0;
372        rightPadding = 0;
373        topPadding = 0;
374        bottomPadding = 0;
375        verticalOffset = 0;
376        horizontalOffset = width / 2;
377
378        findSize();
379
380        //restore cell sizes based on padding
381        leftPadding = tempLeftPadding;
382        rightPadding = tempRightPadding;
383        topPadding = tempTopPadding;
384        bottomPadding = tempBottomPadding;
385        verticalOffset += topPadding;
386        horizontalOffset += leftPadding;
387        width += leftPadding + rightPadding;
388        height += topPadding + bottomPadding;
389    }
390
391    private void findSize() {
392        int left = Integer.MAX_VALUE, right = Integer.MIN_VALUE,
393                top = Integer.MAX_VALUE, bottom = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
394        HashMap<Direction, Integer> larges = new HashMap<>();
395
396        BufferedImage image = new BufferedImage(width, height, BufferedImage.TYPE_4BYTE_ABGR);
397        Graphics2D g = image.createGraphics();
398        g.setFont(font);
399
400        g.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_RENDERING, RenderingHints.VALUE_RENDER_QUALITY);
401        if (antialias) {
402            g.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING, RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_ON);
403        } else {
404            g.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING, RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_OFF);
405        }
406
407        FontRenderContext context = g.getFontRenderContext();
408
409        for (int i = 0; i < fitting.length();) {
410            int code = fitting.codePointAt(i);
411            GlyphVector vect = font.createGlyphVector(context, Character.toChars(code));
412            if (vect.getGlyphCode(0) != font.getMissingGlyphCode()
413                    && Character.isValidCodePoint(code)
414                    && !Character.isISOControl(code)
415                    && !Character.isWhitespace(code)) {
416                Rectangle rect = vect.getGlyphPixelBounds(0, context, 0, 0);
417                if (rect.x < left) {
418                    larges.put(Direction.LEFT, code);
419                    left = rect.x;
420                }
421                if (rect.y < top) {
422                    larges.put(Direction.UP, code);
423                    top = rect.y;
424                }
425                if (rect.x + rect.width > right) {
426                    larges.put(Direction.RIGHT, code);
427                    right = rect.x + rect.width;
428                }
429                if (rect.y + rect.height > bottom) {
430                    larges.put(Direction.DOWN, code);
431                    bottom = rect.y + rect.height;
432                }
433            }
434            i += Character.charCount(code);
435        }
436        largeCharacters = new HashSet<>(larges.values());
437
438        width = right - left;
439        width *= 2;
440        height = bottom - top;
441        height *= 2;
442        horizontalOffset = width / 2;
443        verticalOffset = 0;
444        if (width > 0 && height > 0) {
445            trimCell();
446        }
447    }
448
449    private void trimCell() {
450        BufferedImage image = new BufferedImage(width, height, BufferedImage.TYPE_BYTE_GRAY);
451
452        //find best horizontal offset
453        int bestHorizontalOffset = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
454        for (int code : largeCharacters) {
455            int tempHorizontalOffset = horizontalOffset;
456            if (visible(code, image)) {//only calculate on printable characters
457                while (horizontalOffset > -width && willFit(code)) {
458                    horizontalOffset--;
459                }
460            }
461            bestHorizontalOffset = Math.max(bestHorizontalOffset, Math.min(tempHorizontalOffset, horizontalOffset + 1));//slide back one to the right if we slid left
462            horizontalOffset = tempHorizontalOffset;
463        }
464        horizontalOffset = bestHorizontalOffset;
465
466        //find best vertical offset
467        int bestVerticalOffset = Integer.MIN_VALUE;
468        for (int code : largeCharacters) {
469            int tempVerticalOffset = verticalOffset;
470            while (verticalOffset > -height && willFit(code)) {
471                verticalOffset--;
472            }
473            bestVerticalOffset = Math.max(bestVerticalOffset, Math.min(tempVerticalOffset, verticalOffset + 1));//slide back down one if slid up
474            verticalOffset = tempVerticalOffset;
475        }
476        verticalOffset = bestVerticalOffset;
477
478        int bestWidth = 1;
479        int bestHeight = 1;
480
481        //squeeze back down to rectangle cell
482        for (int code : largeCharacters) {
483
484            //squeeze width
485            int tempWidth = width;
486            while (width > 0 && willFit(code)) {
487                width--;
488            }
489            bestWidth = Math.max(bestWidth, width + 1);//take whatever the largest needed width so far is
490            width = tempWidth;
491
492            //squeeze height
493            int tempHeight = height;
494            while (height > 0 && willFit(code)) {
495                height--;
496            }
497            bestHeight = Math.max(bestHeight, height + 1);//take whatever the largest needed height so far is
498            height = tempHeight;
499        }
500
501        //set cell sizes based on found best sizes
502        width = bestWidth;
503        height = bestHeight;
504    }
505
506    private void sizeCellByDimension() {
507        int desiredWidth = width;
508        int desiredHeight = height;
509
510        //try provided font size first
511        initializeByFont(font);
512
513        if (width > desiredWidth || height > desiredHeight) {//try font sizes and take largest that fits if passed in font is too large
514            int largeSide = Math.max(width, height);
515            if (largeSide > 0) {
516                int fontSize = font.getSize();
517                int largeDesiredSide = Math.max(desiredWidth, desiredHeight);
518                fontSize = largeDesiredSide * fontSize / largeSide;//approximately the right ratio
519                fontSize *= 1.2;//pad just a bit
520
521                do {
522                    font = new Font(font.getFontName(), font.getStyle(), fontSize);
523                    initializeByFont(font);
524                    fontSize--;
525                } while (width > desiredWidth || height > desiredHeight);
526
527                horizontalOffset += (desiredWidth - width) / 2;//increase by added width, err on the side of one pixel left of center
528                verticalOffset += (desiredHeight - height) / 2;
529                width = desiredWidth;
530                height = desiredHeight;
531            }
532        }
533
534        map.clear();
535    }
536
537    private boolean visible(int code, BufferedImage i) {
538        BufferedImage testImage = makeMonoImage(code, i);
539        //work from middle out to maximize chance of finding visilble bit
540        int startx = testImage.getWidth() / 2;
541        for (int x = 0; x <= startx; x++) {
542            for (int y = 0; y < testImage.getHeight(); y++) {
543                if (startx + x < testImage.getWidth()) {//make sure no overflow on rounding
544                    if (testImage.getRGB(x + startx, y) != Color.WHITE.getRGB() || testImage.getRGB(startx - x, y) != Color.WHITE.getRGB()) {
545                        return true;//found a filled in pixel
546                    }
547                }
548            }
549        }
550
551        return false;//no pixels found
552    }
553
554    private boolean willFit(int code, BufferedImage image) {
555        if (Character.isISOControl(code)) {//make sure it's a printable character
556            return true;
557        }
558
559        for (Direction dir : Direction.CARDINALS) {
560            if (!testSlide(code, dir, image)) {
561                return false;
562            }
563        }
564
565        //all the needed space was clear!
566        return true;
567    }
568
569    /**
570     * Returns true if the given character will fit inside the current cell
571     * dimensions with the current font.
572     *
573     * ISO Control characters, non-printing characters and invalid unicode
574     * characters are all considered by definition to fit.
575     *
576     * @param codepoint
577     * @return
578     */
579    public boolean willFit(int codepoint) {
580        if (!initialized) {
581            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
582        }
583        
584        if (!Character.isValidCodePoint(codepoint) || Character.isISOControl(codepoint)) {
585            return true;
586        }
587
588        return willFit(codepoint, new BufferedImage(width, height, BufferedImage.TYPE_BYTE_GRAY));
589    }
590
591    /**
592     * Slides the character one pixel in the provided direction and test if
593     * fully exposed the opposite edge. Returns true if opposite edge was fully
594     * exposed.
595     *
596     * @param code
597     * @param dir
598     * @return
599     */
600    private boolean testSlide(int code, Direction dir, BufferedImage image) {
601        //set offsets in a direction to test if it cleared the space
602        horizontalOffset += dir.deltaX;
603        verticalOffset += dir.deltaY;
604
605        BufferedImage testImage = makeMonoImage(code, image);
606
607        //reset offsets to actual values
608        horizontalOffset -= dir.deltaX;
609        verticalOffset -= dir.deltaY;
610
611        int startx = 0, starty = 0, endx = 0, endy = 0;//end points should be included in check
612        switch (dir) {//set values to check edge opposite of movement
613            case RIGHT:
614                endy = height - 1;
615                break;
616            case LEFT:
617                startx = width - 1;
618                endx = startx;
619                endy = height - 1;
620                break;
621            case UP:
622                endx = width - 1;
623                starty = height - 1;
624                endy = starty;
625                break;
626            case DOWN:
627                endx = width - 1;
628        }
629
630        //test for edge hit
631        for (int x = startx; x <= endx; x++) {
632            for (int y = starty; y <= endy; y++) {
633                if (testImage.getRGB(x, y) != Color.WHITE.getRGB()) {
634                    return false;//found an edge that would normally be printed off the cell
635                }
636            }
637        }
638        return true;
639    }
640
641    /**
642     * Returns the image of the character represented by the passed in code
643     * point.
644     *
645     * @param code the unicode code point for the character to draw
646     * @param color the color to draw
647     * @return
648     */
649    public BufferedImage get(int code, Color color) {
650        if (!initialized) {
651            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
652        }
653        
654        String search = asKey(code, color);
655        BufferedImage block = map.get(search);
656
657        if (block == null) {
658            block = makeImage(code, color);
659            map.put(search, block);
660        }
661        return block;
662    }
663
664    /**
665     * Returns the string used as a key for hash mapping. Useful for drop-in
666     * replacement of text and images.
667     *
668     * @param code the unicode code point for the character to draw
669     * @param color the color to draw
670     * @return
671     */
672    public String asKey(int code, Color color) {
673        if (!initialized) {
674            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
675        }
676        
677        return new String(Character.toChars(code)) + " " + color.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": " + Integer.toHexString(color.getRGB());
678    }
679
680    /**
681     * Returns a solid block of the provided color.
682     *
683     * @param color
684     * @return
685     */
686    public BufferedImage getSolid(Color color) {
687        if (!initialized) {
688            throw new IllegalStateException("This factory has not yet been initialized!");
689        }
690        
691        String search = "Solid " + color.getClass().getSimpleName() + ": " + Integer.toHexString(color.getRGB());
692        BufferedImage block = map.get(search);
693
694        if (block == null) {
695            block = new BufferedImage(width, height, BufferedImage.TYPE_4BYTE_ABGR);
696            Graphics2D g = block.createGraphics();
697            g.setColor(color);
698            g.fillRect(0, 0, block.getWidth(), block.getHeight());
699            map.put(search, block);
700        }
701        return block;
702    }
703
704    private BufferedImage makeMonoImage(int code, BufferedImage i) {
705        Graphics2D g = i.createGraphics();
706        g.setColor(SColor.WHITE);
707        g.fillRect(0, 0, i.getWidth(), i.getHeight());
708        drawForeground(g, code, Color.BLACK);
709        return i;
710    }
711
712    private BufferedImage makeImage(int code, Color color) {
713        BufferedImage i = new BufferedImage(width, height, BufferedImage.TYPE_4BYTE_ABGR);
714        Graphics2D g = i.createGraphics();
715        drawForeground(g, code, color);
716        return i;
717    }
718
719    private void drawForeground(Graphics2D g, int code, Color color) {
720        g.setColor(color);
721        g.setFont(font);
722
723        g.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_RENDERING, RenderingHints.VALUE_RENDER_QUALITY);
724        if (antialias) {
725            g.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING, RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_ON);
726        } else {
727            g.setRenderingHint(RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING, RenderingHints.VALUE_ANTIALIAS_OFF);
728        }
729
730        int x = horizontalOffset - g.getFontMetrics().charWidth(code) / 2;//start with half of the character's width
731        int y = g.getFontMetrics().getMaxAscent() + verticalOffset;
732        g.drawString(new String(Character.toChars(code)), x, y);
733    }
734}
